attributes.action: Tell us what level of patient care is planned in the NHS for June 2018
attributes.background:
Following the small increased funding for the NHS in the November 2017 budget what will be the following measures of the care it plans compared to this year:
•	expected waiting times 
•	areas and the quantification of care rationing that will take place 
•	estimated numbers of bed-blockers
attributes.additional_details: The information that is available concerning problems in the NHS is sufficient to cause worry that health and social care will deteriorate. We need to understand what level of care is planned by the Government so that we can make a case for a revision in the funding if necessary.

attributes.action: Fix the date for coming out of the customs union and single market for Dec 2020
attributes.background: To stop the Government extending the leaving date of the customs union and single market. That we leave on December 2020 with no more implementation period or extended.

attributes.action:
Prevent child abduction and work to ensure abducted children are
repatriated.
attributes.background: Approximately 500 cases of International Parental Child Abduction take place each year (that equates to ten a week) - these are figures from the FCO. Exit controls at the border were abolished in 1998, so court orders, alerts and other safeguards to prevent abduction cannot be effectively enforced.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government must raise awareness of the problem with public
authorities so that they can formulate more effective preventative
measures.

The Government must introduce a fully funded team dedicated to liaising with foreign Governments and fund legal action abroad to ensure that children are repatriated to the UK. The Government must implement the recommendations of the Law Commission to reform of sections 1 and 2 of the Child Abduction Act 1984.

attributes.action: Amend Hate Speech Laws
attributes.background: "Hate Crime is any criminal offence [...] which is perceived to be motivated by hostility or prejudice." Law enforcement will find it difficult to fully determine the motivations behind the speech or actions. As such, the law should be changed to "proven to be motivated by" to avoid ambiguity.

attributes.action: Ban the sale, and use of any tool designed to cause pain/fear in training dogs.
attributes.background:
After the successful banning of the shock collar - let's get tools that are inherently designed to cause pain or fear banned too. This includes but not limited to choke/prong/pinch/spray collars/devices.

There is NO place in using pain or fear to train any dog whether a pet or working.

attributes.action: New law on the ratio of qualified staff/carers to patients in nursing homes
attributes.background: My father was neglected in a care home. There is no minimum legal ratio or a requirement on public or private care facilities to employ a minimum number of staff. I have spent 5 years speaking, researching and gleaning information on this matter.
attributes.additional_details: I had to employ the services of my local MP who contacted The Care Quality Commission on my behalf. I should have been listened to immediately and my concerns taken seriously without having to involve my MP. I have spoken with many carers/qualified nursing staff in nursing homes and in the community, and they believe, that there is neglect is because there is no legal ratio requirement.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for workers under 18 years old.
attributes.background: The minimum wage for all will rise in April of 2018, but that of under 18s by a lesser amount. Young people between the ages of 16 and 18 may sustain themselves for a variety of reasons, and it is limiting, unnecessary and frankly insulting to be legally paid almost half the wage of our colleagues.
attributes.additional_details:
The gov website on the National Minimum Wage states that 'Typical hourly earnings for 16-17 year olds were £5.15 in 2014 and £6.53 for 18-20 year olds (both excluding apprentices). This compares to £11.74 for workers aged 21 and over.'

www.google.co.uk/amp/www.independent.co.uk/property/first-time-buyer-age-increase-1960s-housing-market-cost-property-ladder-a8244501.html%3famp

www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/money/2014/jan/21/record-levels-young-adults-living-home-ons

attributes.action: Increase financial support for students
attributes.background: Data shows student rents can swallow up to 95% of the current monthly instalment, resulting in negative effects on students' mental health and academic attainment. This also disproportionately impacts students from lower income backgrounds and is a limit on their ability to access higher education.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.savethestudent.org/accommodation/national-student-accommodation-survey-2018.html

attributes.action: Make it illegal for Nurseries to charge on Bank Holidays or when closed.
attributes.background: I am a full time working parent, I have been since my daughter was 9 months old. I have paid in the region of £1300-950 a month for my child to attend full time nursery. Nurseries still have the right to charge full fees when closed or Bank holidays. Which means double fees or unpaid/annual leave.
attributes.additional_details: I understand it is so difficult for mums to take that leap back to work when childcare costs so much money!!! Unless you're unemployed or less hours you don't seem to be entitled to anything. Nurseries then have the right to charge for days the nursery is closed. Including Bank Holidays, training days & other. Some of us working parents that don't have family then have to pay out double fees or have to take annual or unpaid leave for this facility. It's another penalty that should not be allowed.

attributes.action: Audit every MP and Lord to check on the Cyber Security of their office
attributes.background: In the light of claims made by some MPs on twitter that they have shared their computer password with their office team we believe there is a major cyber security risk throughout the Palace of Westminster.
attributes.additional_details: We understand that the rules set out for employees in Westminster make it clear that passwords should not be disclosed to other people. However the tweets referred to above indicate that at least 2 MPs have failed to follow these rules.

attributes.action: Close the financial support gap for students taking a leave of absence
attributes.background: We call for the Department of Work and Pensions, in line with the policy of Student Finance England, to recognise students taking a leave of absence as no longer full-time students, and thus eligible to claim benefits including Housing Benefit, Income Support, JSA, and ESA and Universal Credit.
attributes.additional_details:
Students on a leave of absence are not considered to be full-time students by SFE, so their loan and maintenance payments stop. The DWP class these students as full-time and thus not eligible for state benefits. 

Students require leave for many reasons, such as illness, disability, bereavement, care duties, pregnancy and parental leave. Current rules place these students in a vulnerable position whereby they may have access to no support at all, pressuring them to drop out of their degrees.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all drivers and bikers to have an onboard camera
attributes.background: My husband was killed in May 2017 while he was doing 15mph on his motorbike. We have never had answers as to what happened that day. There we're 3 other vehicles involved and all statements were different. I feel if they had cameras we would have answers.

attributes.action: Get the UK to ban all single use plastic items by 2030.
attributes.background:
Around 8 million tons of plastic enter the oceans each year, which is like emptying a garbage truck of plastic into an ocean every minute.

Governments MUST realize that the convenience of plastic is not worth the harm it causes

attributes.action: Change the official name & branding of the House of Lords to the House of Peers
attributes.background:
While over 25% of the members of the House of Lords are women, the name erases their existence, ignores their achievements and puts a gendered restriction in the heart of our nation's Parliament.

By changing the official name to the House of Peers, along with all branding, we can fix this mistake
attributes.additional_details: Today is International Women's Day 2018, sixty years since women were first allowed to sit as peers. If we could change our Parliament's name by IWD 2019 to include the 209 female peers who help make our country's laws, that would be a wonderful celebration of 60 years of women in British democracy.

attributes.action: Guarantee divorced/separated parents a minimum level of access to their children
attributes.background: Without a court order a divorced/ seperated parent has no automatic right to see their children. I’d like there to be a set minimum level of access granted to parents without the need for court orders that may take a long time to approve and are very costly to obtain.

attributes.action: Make Debeaking Illegal in the egg and meat industry
attributes.background:
Debeaking is the partial removal of a chicken's beak, commonly used in the egg industry.

It has been proven that a chickens beak is highly sensitive as it is highly nervated (Davis,2004) it has also been proven chickens then have trouble eating as a result of this.
attributes.additional_details:
Debeaking is banned in Sweden, Finland, Norway (Picket H, 2008) Austria (The Ranger, 2014) and Denmark (Farming UK, 2015a). A ban was due to come in force in 2011 but it was postponed until 2016 and is still legal today.

Let's help these poor chickens!

attributes.action: Add the discrimination against people with tattoos to The Equality Act
attributes.background: Currently the discrimination against people with tattoos in and out the work place is evident within the UK, we need to ensure people with tattoos are safe guarded against discrimination

attributes.action: Ban Vaping in public places, vaping to be included in the smoking tobacco act
attributes.background: Treat vaping with the same laws as tobacco smoking, there are toxic fumes coming from vaping, teenagers who vape could move onto cigarettes,  there will be health issues in the future if we allow this trend to continue,  let us try a curb it now before its too late,
attributes.additional_details: I'm not asking for an outright ban, only in public places

attributes.action: Intervene in the slaughter of stray dogs in Russia preceding the 2018 World Cup.
attributes.background: The 2018 FIFA Football World Cup will take place in Russia in June and July. In an attempt to “ensure security and a pleasant stay” and “provide a good image” for visitors, thousands of stray cats and dogs and even birds in host cities are being killed.
attributes.additional_details:
Russia lacks a humane system of shelters, food and medical support for homeless cats and dogs. However, contracts worth $1.95million have been signed in host cities to kill the animals rather than set up shelters or provide spay/neuter and vaccinations programmes. 

Russia must withdraw all contracts and cancel planned slaughter of hundreds of thousands of animals.  

WE ASK OUR GOVERNMENT: Contact the Russian Government and demand the passing of animal protection laws and redirect any foreign aid to support humane solutions to remove stray animals from the streets.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/bloodyFIFA2018/

attributes.action: Give employment rights to contracted employees with less than 2 years service.
attributes.background:
If unfairly dismissed from a position when you have been with a company for less than 2 years, presently you can do nothing about it. 
If you have worked for 2 years or more, you can file for unfair dismissal.
attributes.additional_details:
Example: Jenifer was promoted after 12 months working, but after 4 months in the new position, Jenifer was dismissed. The reason given was that she was not picking the new job up as quickly as the employer thought she should be. 
No further training was offered, or the option to go back to her previous role. This was unfair dismissal, however she had only worked for the company for 18 months. ACAS are not able to assist in this case, which the company knew when dismissing her. Action is needed!

attributes.action: To make the new British passports post Brexit Rainbow colour
attributes.background: One of the major issues for Brexiters is the blue passport of a bygone age. It does not represent the modern multicultural Britain of today. It further fuels the divide. Those supporting the inclusive, vibrant nation that we are today should support a rainbow coloured passport that reflects this.

attributes.action: Create a body to mediate between Insolvency Practioners and those in an IVA.
attributes.background: An IVA typically lasts 5 or 6 years and the debtor  must use the services of an Insolvency Practitioner (IP). Once signed up they are bound to that IP, regardless of quality of service. they have no access to mediation. See https://www.iva.co.uk/forum/another-petition-f145-t83980 for background.
attributes.additional_details: Where there is a dispute between a creditor and debtor, the debtor can turn to the Financial Ombudsman for mediation / resolution. However, in an IVA there is no mechanism for mediation / resolution. The debtor has to rely on the insolvency firms complaints procedure and then the IP’s regulatory body.  BUT … the regulatory bodies do not intervene. They will not alter or make an IP alter their course of action, even if proven incorrect. The debtor gets no restitution nor is the dispute settled

attributes.action: Introduce renewable temporary stay for anyone who has been in UK for 14 years
attributes.background: The previous immigration law allows anyone who has been in the UK for 14years to be eligible for permanent residence. However, this was removed in 2010 with government view to removing all overstayers even if they have been in the UK for more than 14years.
attributes.additional_details:
However, recent government reports showed there have been no changes to the number of people deported who have been in the UK for 14years or more as these sets of people are either already have a settled family.

In the light of the above, the government should introduce legal renewable temporary stay for anyone who has been in the UK for more than 14 years without a criminal record so that these sets of people will be able to work legally, contribute to the UK economy positively and pay taxes.

attributes.action: Fund baby hatches to allow newborns to be left safely and anonymously
attributes.background:
There have been several cases of newborn babies being abandoned. Most recently and sadly was the case of baby Pearl in Rochdale, Manchester who was found dead in the woods. 
Many countries have baby hatches to allow babies to be abandoned safely, where they can receive immediate attention.
attributes.additional_details:
Belgium, Germany and Canada have introduced baby hatches where a parent can abandon their newborn baby anonymously. This means that despite this desperate act, the infant is safe and warm and an alert is generated so that someone arrives to care for the child straight away. 
This is scheme is needed in the UK to ensure that these parents have a safe space to leave their child and do not have to resort to leaving the infant at risk.

attributes.action: Only allow students to register to vote in one constituency
attributes.background: In the 2017 general election students registered to vote in their town and university town. I would like them to only be able to register to vote in one constituency in general elections.

attributes.action: Please give every child in England the opportunity to study Classics.
attributes.background: Threatened by govt funding cuts and a reputation of elitism & irrelevance, the study of Classics in state schools is in peril.Yet, it continues to be taught in most private schools-for good reason. Classics explores what is eternal about humanity. It teaches us to think & debate. Skills we all need.
attributes.additional_details: Classical ideals of wisdom & virtue formed the foundations of our education system. Increasingly however, we have adopted a more utilitarian approach to the education of the majority: where the focus is the creation of individuals whose labours can best serve the economy.The type of education system we create, determines the type of society we create. A stressful, competitive system that focuses on preparing students to be valuable to an economy, does not nurture the healthiest individuals - nor the healthiest societies.

attributes.action: the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards" to British citizens
attributes.background: Many British citizens, while staying in other European countries, risk being fined for failing to carry a national identity card or passport, because the British passport is insufficiently small or durable to carry at all times. Therefore the UK should issue optional self-funding "passport cards".

attributes.action: Government to pay for all car repairs caused by potholes
attributes.background: We all pay car tax and council tax and yet our roads are left in unsafe and damaged conditions many of witch need ripping up and relaying completely which can cause serious damage to our cars. Having paid the tax, we should not have to pay for any damage to wheels, suspension, track rods, cv joints.
attributes.additional_details: These roads are being reported yet only a temporary fix or not at all until such time the roads are safe to drive on with out the risk of damage the local council or government should pick up the bills.

attributes.action:
Stop Shisha Smoking in the UK
It increases your risk of cancer, heart disease
attributes.background:
Stop Shisha Smoking in the UK
Smoking Shisha can be 100 times more harmful than smoking cigarettes. It increases your risk of cancer, heart disease and respiratory disease.
attributes.additional_details: A World Health Organization study has suggested that during one session on a hookah (around 20 to 80 minutes) a person can inhale the same amount of smoke as a cigarette smoker consuming 100 or more cigarettes. Hookah smoke also contains nicotine, cancer-causing chemicals and toxic gases such as carbon monoxide.Despite the wholesome-sounding flavours, shisha tobacco is just as dangerous and is linked to the same life-threatening diseases, such as heart disease and cancer.

attributes.action: Ban the testing of household cleaning product ingredients on animals.
attributes.background: There is no law in the UK that bans the testing of cleaning products on animals. This is a cruel practice with no practical use whatsoever. I urge you to please sign this petition if you , like me love animals and do not want to see them suffer.

attributes.action: Make it legal for motorcyclists to ride without a helmet on
attributes.background: In the UK it has been illegal for most to ride with a helmet on. This does not apply to certain religious groups. I think that bikers from all walks of life should get the choice if they use a helmet or not.
attributes.additional_details: When Motor Cycles (Wearing of Helmets) Regulations 1973 (S.I., 1973, No. 180) was passed, it became illegal in the UK for anyone to ride without a helmet on. This was amended by the Crash-Helmets (Religious Exemption) Act, 1976, to give some groups the ability to opt out of using them. I don't debate that they have saved lives, but a study done in the US stated that it was only a 37% decrease. Furthermore it is primarily the biker that will face the consequences, so why force them into using one.

attributes.action: For schools to sing the national anthem
attributes.background: I believe the national anthem is a important part of our country values and traditions. I grew up hearing the song -shows great respect to our queen and monarchy. I feel there have been debates about this - I personally would not like the song to lose it's importance for our Country, Queen - God
attributes.additional_details: I believe the national anthem is a important part of our country it mentions our god - our queen and shows the world the importance of the  monarchy and the great respect we have for our country traditions and the queen and our fellow men and women who have lost their lifes for our country.This song holds a important place in England's traditions being sing at football and commonwealth games and like other countries we should sing our national anthem with pride - many share my views.

attributes.action: A commemorative plaque for the contributions made by the Windrush Generation.
attributes.background: As a result of the recent  negative treatment of the Windrush Generation,   we should instead  acknowledge their invaluable contributions to the successes of British life over the years.

attributes.action: Raise the issue of using big cats as photo props with the Thai goverment
attributes.background:
Recently, tigers and lions have become the centre of a cruel and barbaric attraction. The now 'in thing' to do is have your picture taken with a tiger or lion which is fuelled completely by tourists and celebrities.

However, these animals are drugged up and live in vile conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has worked hard at ending animal cruelty and continues to do so. However, much of Thailand is only just recognising the concept of animal welfare. The now 'in thing' to do is have your picture taken with a tiger or lion which is fuelled completely by tourists.

However, the truth behind these 'tiger selfies' is a sad and heart-breaking scene. The animals are drugged to ensure they are 'safe' to have selfies with. Furthermore, the conditions in which they are kept are cramped and filthy.

attributes.action: Include cycle paths in post-Brexit farming subsidies
attributes.background: Rewarding farmers for providing cycle paths across farmland, would offer safe routes to schools and work, connecting villages and towns. This would reduce pollution, provide leisure opportunities, compensate for lost bus services and contribute to the well being of the nation.

attributes.action: A petition to action Government to posthumously pardon all Suffragettes
attributes.background: From 1900 to the beginning of WW1 approximately 1,000 women were imprisoned in the British campaign to gain the votes for women.These women suffered and sacrificed a lifetime for generations today to live an equal life.These women should be posthumously pardoned and celebrated for their bravery.
attributes.additional_details: As a relative of Emmeline Pankhurst there has never been a more appropriate time to pursue the notion of having suffragettes that were imprisoned during the Votes for Women campaign posthumously pardoned and their efforts celebrated. Despite the peaceful efforts of Millicent Fawcett, Emmeline and her daughters at the start of the campaign, progress was slow and their voices dampened. Many courageous women pushed the campaign forward in a way that ensured their voices were heard 'Votes for Women'

attributes.action: Invest more money in youth charities and youth service providers in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a profound reduction in services for young people resulting from funding cuts. With huge pressures on all local authority budgets, these cuts won’t be reversed. We have to support the organisations who help young people from areas with high levels of deprivation and low income backgrounds.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2012, in London alone at least £22 million has been cut from council youth service budgets and 12,700 places for young people have been lost. The average council has cut its youth service budget by nearly £1 million, an average of 36%. (London's Lost Youth Services, 2017).

Across the country more than 1 in 10 think their life will amount to nothing, no matter how hard they try. 42% of young people feel traditional goals like getting a steady job are unrealistic (Prince's Trust, 2017).

attributes.action: Leave the MOT tests for all vehicles the same and remove future changes.
attributes.background: I’m writing this petition to raise the thoughts on the up coming changes for the MOT tests towards vehicles. This is to raise the thoughts of others that don’t believe the changes are fair and that these changes are going to have a large effect on vehicles and history.

attributes.action: Establish a support body to advise and protect Beneficiaries of Wills and Trusts
attributes.background: Support body to provide free help and advice to beneficiaries:  To ensure proper estate administration.  Advising on; confusing Will language, dwindling estate concerns, uncertainty of legal rights, high executor fee charges, lack of transparency or information, unresponsive administrators etc.
attributes.additional_details:
This support body (funded by increase in Probate tax) to:-

•Provide legal advice to beneficiaries in clear and simple terms   
•Ensure executor accountability 
•Have powers to take action against executors to protect beneficiaries where there are failings in responsibilities and duty of care.

We ask for Parliament to change the law, ensuring that executors are legally bound to clearly inform beneficiaries of the existence of this body and provide its contact details with Will delivery.

attributes.action: Debate a national Long Service and Good Conduct medal for all NHS staff.
attributes.background: We do not recognise the contribution NHS staff make to our local communities and to the nation as a whole.  I feel medals should be awarded at 30 years and 50 years continuous unbroken service to all NHS staff who complete that amount of service.
attributes.additional_details: 30 year medal should be called the Long Service and Good conduct Medal and 50 years service should be called the Meritorious Service Medal.  Unbroken service should include Maternity leave, sick leave and bank staff and part time staff.  The medal should say " From a grateful nation" on it.  Ribbon colours and design should be put to NHS staff for their ideas.

attributes.action: Make AED Defibrillators available more publicly (at least every second street).
attributes.background: AED Defibrillators are a crucial part of basic first aid. Cardiac arrest involves a person being on the verge of dying. Cardiopulmonary Resusictation (CPR) is effective but AED defibrillators may double the chance of a person surviving. This could potentially save your or a loved one life.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the British Heart Foundation, 100,000 people die from sudden cardiac arrest each year. Without treatment, 95% of the time a cardiac arrest results in death. Having a defibrillator in close proximity is vital, as 80% of cardiac arrests occur at home, with every minute of it being untreated the chance of survival falls by 9%. Having a defibrillator in every street or two, and making neighbors aware of it saves valuable time in treatment and thousands of lives!
Sign up to Save!

attributes.action: Stop assessing higher education students on their parental income!
attributes.background: As a student In a living in a city, being able to survive on student finance is challenging. Like most students the money I have to survive on is assessed by parental income, not taking into account mortgages and other bills to pay.
attributes.additional_details:
Many students I've spoken to are in a similar situation, Their parents would love to help them out with an additional £3-£4k per year but financially aren't in this position. Thus meaning they are unable to support us as student finance believes they should/could.

Due to the lack of student finance for our future workforce, we are forced into overdrafts before leaving education.

attributes.action: UK govt to build a ship which can remove and recycle plastic from the oceans
attributes.background:
There are "islands" of plastic in our oceans which are 1- dangerous to marine life;  2- polluting our world; 3- a waste of resources
4- a human problem.
The UK govt could lead the world by building a ship which can collect the plastic, process it and bring to the UK to reuse the plastic
attributes.additional_details:
Ecological - There are millions of tons of resources lying on the ocean, we put it there, we should retrieve it. 

Resource - The technology exists to collect and re-use that plastic resource (think of it like a natural resource which we can mine and exploit). We can build infrastructure projects with free plastic!

Britain was built on a sea-faring heritage. Post-Brexit, this is an opportunity to show that we still lead the world. 

Finally, why would you or any country say "no"?

attributes.action: Prohibit the act of infant male circumcision without a proper medical reasoning.
attributes.background: Male circumcision in infants is an unnecessary, irreversible and unfair procedure to place upon a boy who may in the future disagree with the reasons for which it was done. Religion and parental opinion are not appropriate reasons to remove a part of a boys body when they lack the ability to refuse.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition goes against strapping a infant boy to a table and cutting away at his genitals without medical reasoning. It does not go against voluntary circumcision by a consenting person.
Issue's like Phimosis, are an appropriate reason to conduct such a procedure as the condition is uncomfortable and fixable. It is known the procedure has no link to higher chances of STD's or HIV in the western world. Promoting safe sex is an alternative to preemptive surgery that is in turn irreversible.

attributes.action: Make typing and full keyboard skills a compulsory part of secondary education.
attributes.background:
Children today are having to do much of their education online and on computers.  Yet they are not taught to type properly.  This leads to slow work and frustration.  
We do not give a child a pencil and expect them to learn to write. Yet we give them a keyboard and expect them to learn to type.

attributes.action: Permit all public universities to test cannabis for medical use
attributes.background: Cannabis is widely believed to have broad medical applications, and there is solid evidence to support some of these. We cannot know the true extent without research. It seems obvious that the current restriction is based on ideology rather than evidence, and this stance is academically unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: Cannabis has been shown to improve the endurance of cancer patients and to improve the experiences of those with chronic pain.  Cannabis has also been shown to be minimally addictive and minimally harmful to health, whilst the debate over its social detriments has contained more heat than light.  The way to put this to bed, one way or the other, is to let the academics test it and find out exactly what it does.  We permit tests on other classes of drugs including opiates, why not cannabis?

attributes.action: Action an effective NHS care pathway for patients with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome
attributes.background: EDS is an inherited connective tissue abnormality.People with EDS have no care within the NHS. Healthcarer's have no access to formal training, forcing patients to self fund private care with the few specialists available, in order to manage their multiple,painful & life threatening disabilities.
attributes.additional_details:
EDS UK and the Royal College of GP's are working together to improve education on EDS and to create a 'toolkit' for GP's managing patients with the condition. (https://www.ehlers-danlos.org/news/spotlight/). 

At present, patients like myself are forced to fundraise for urgent and long term care to manage disabilities, extreme pain, dislocations, and at times life saving surgeries abroad. No specialist area has claimed the condition leaving GP's unaware of who to refer patients to for their care

attributes.action: Serious injuries caused by careless driving should lead to imprisonment.
attributes.background: People's lives are completely changed for the worst due to drivers lack of care on the road. Victims of this often result there pain in suicide, leaving a large strain on not only the victims' lives but the people around them.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers do not deserve to walk away freely from the pain they have caused.

attributes.action:
Mandatory signs on all disabled facilities -
"Not all disabilities are visible"
attributes.background: Since developing a chronic urinary disease, I have found myself needing to use disabled facilities often. However, due to not bearing any obvious or visible disability and only a hidden one, I have faced criticism and been confronted on many occasions as to why I am using such facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Myself and thousands of other people who suffer from unseen disabilities are having to defend ourselves and on many occasions show proof as to why they need to use disabled facilities. 
When I am in need to use the disabled loos, I have often been confronted by others. This is discrimination.

I am petitioning for all disabled facilities in the UK to bear mandatory signs reading "Not all disabilities are visible". 
This is to aim to put a stop to such discrimination and prejudice.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for drivers to hit and run when hitting a domestic animal
attributes.background: This point needs to be put into action because domesticated animals being killed with no justice is no option and should be a criminal offence. When an animal companion is removed it leaves people feeling very alone and broken, looking for justice that currently can’t be served - personal experience
